I don't know if it is my PC's setting or the actual game itself or the way skidrow compacted/stored/cracked this game, however, I am having some major problems

* The game crashes at random points frequently, very VERY annoying considering you have to start from the beginning of a mission

* Probably because of the above problem, my pc setting of the game i.e. graphic settings does not get saved. Very annoying to have to change the setting every time you play

* Other than that at the moment perhaps audio quality is a little on the downside. However, it could be my shit speakers, shit sound device on my PC

Anyone else have similar problems? Great game, great attempt at sharing this game skidrow, however, i am disappointed :(

Not worth the download imho.  Another crappy console port.  There is NO tutorial, they just throw you into the game.  There is no readme.  There is kind of a tutorial in-game except for the fact that it is for a 360 controller.  The cut scenes are retarded and if you miss one move you have to start from the beginning.  The game would skip some frames every few seconds no matter what the settings were on.  I wouldn't recommend this game especially if you have limited bandwidth.

@jonny909
Reinstall DirectX, OR search for the dll on Google, there're a bunch of DLL sites out there that'll have it. When you've got it, put it in your Windows/System32/ folder. If that doesn't work, put it in the same folder as the Ninja Blade executable.

In my first opinion, this game is almost too much like Ninja Gaiden 2 not that I'm actually saying it is or that I am mad about it. It has the same fighting system and almost looks alike on the ninja's uniform, but I will say that there are different enemies and some cool effects like falling off buildings and stuff. I love this game even though it only has three different types of weapons. This is the closest game I could find for PC of being like ninja gaiden 2 and I love the experience.
